channel.title: JS Image Rollover
channel.description: I'm trying to make an image rollover. Basically an image with hovering. But it isn't working. I'm probably doing something wrong but here's the code I'm using: [code] [/code] Whenever I put it in a file on Dreamweaver and preview the site, it works. But when I put it in the file that's uploaded to my host, it doesn't. Can anyone help me? I've been told to use CSS but I don't really understand CSS.

item.title: JS Image Rollover
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

The original image shows up but nothing happens when I hover over the image.

Wrap the CSS in style tags at the top of your page inside your head tags.

Read full topic

item.title: JS Image Rollover
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:3, topic:458874”]I’m not entirely sure if this will help, but I’m sure it’s what you’re looking for.

.imgswap {
  background-image:url("bottom-image.jpg"); 
  background-repeat: no-repeat; 
  display:block;
}
.imgswap:hover img {
visibility:hidden;
} 
<div class="imgswap">
 <img src="top-image.jpg">
</div>

This will swap one image with another image when a mouse is hovering over it.[/quote]

Do I just make a file called “main.ccs” and put the CSS code in it?

Read full topic

item.title: JS Image Rollover
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I’m not entirely sure if this will help, but I’m sure it’s what you’re looking for.

.imgswap {
  background-image:url("bottom-image.jpg"); 
  background-repeat: no-repeat; 
  display:block;
}
.imgswap:hover img {
visibility:hidden;
} 
<div class="imgswap">
 <img src="top-image.jpg">
</div>

This will swap one image with another image when a mouse is hovering over it.

Read full topic

item.title: JS Image Rollover
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I’m trying to make an image rollover. Basically an image with hovering. But it isn’t working. I’m probably doing something wrong but here’s the code I’m using:

<a href="support/" onmouseout="MM_swapImgRestore()" onmouseover="MM_swapImage('Image8','','images/game/supportHover.png',1)"> <img src="images/game/support.png" name="Image8" width="120" height="54" border="0" id="support" /></a>

Whenever I put it in a file on Dreamweaver and preview the site, it works. But when I put it in the file that’s uploaded to my host, it doesn’t. Can anyone help me? I’ve been told to use CSS but I don’t really understand CSS.

Read full topic
